website_summaries.verdict: With its high-end security measures, versatile storage options, and decent price, this NAS device is a worthy solution for your data needs.
pros: Easy to create a personal cloud service
cons: Not the speediest NAS device on the market

customer_reviews.title: WORST, the unit locks up if disk full - total data loss
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable, but true, if you run the unit out of disk space the NAS will lock up, there is no way to access the OS or the data. Your only option is to do a complete reformat and install of the RAID. Meaning TOTAL data loss. The OS has no warnings or safeguards. This is with the latest firmware 4 as of Sept 2018. Buffalo Tech Support will tell you to send the drives out to a third party for data recovery! That is their best fix. So I'm doing the amazon return right now on both the units I purchased. Glad it happened when the units were only a week old so hopeful I can purchase something more normal.
customer_reviews.author: don schilling

customer_reviews.title: Fan failure within 2 weeks of receipt
customer_reviews.text: I received the Buffalo TerraStation on July 17th, spent a long time setting up the device on my network, and uploaded almost half a terabyte of data to it. 12 days later, the fan failed, the machine became unresponsive, failing to respond even to the shutdown command (holding the power button for 3 seconds on the front of the machine, not through the portal, which of course failed to respond). This device is clearly not made well if components that are required to keep the drives healthy (preventing overheating) fail within two weeks of receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Rice

customer_reviews.title: Cooling fans failed after only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Cooling fans failed after only 3 months and return window elapsed after 1 month and product support elapses after 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but wish the NFS support was better.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with the exception of the NFS drivers. CIFS (Samba) mounts work great, but the NFS support has issues with long file names, especially those with unusual characters in them. Unfortunately the CIFS support doesn't seem to report directory updates to connected servers. Overall, the product does what it says on the box. Lots of storage with RAID5 data security, which is great, i just would have thought that since the box seems to be linux-based, that the NFS support would have been better. Just to deflect the immediate question, switching to NFS on kernel mode actually made the support worse. Still, for 12TB of usable storage, the price is pretty reasonably.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Naujok

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Terrible Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. While Buffalo's support was decent to a point, they refused to RMA or replace my failed unit. I wasted hours of my life trying to get their firmware and software to work and gave up. My fan gave out after a month of use, and because of that was outside of Amazon's return policy. I ended up pulling the drives from this unit and purchasing a OWC quad elite unit. SHOCKER! It works perfectly with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: colorplates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I loved this TeraStation: excellent engineering, looks cool, small form factor. I configured it to work as I initially intended a NAS to work. It works as described and designed. I inadvertently set a couple options wrong and was unable to correct it. Contacted manufacturer, unable to fix but restoring to factory default, and allowed to return with RMA without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Maudiib

customer_reviews.title: Easiest NAS setup! Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have set up several different NAS in my time, and this was by far the easiest. Price point was spot-on and convenience of having drives already installed and formatted was excellent. This little guy makes less noise than my Cisco switch - and I was making backups and mapping shares to the network files within an hour. Note to others: I kept receiving security credential error when attempting to map drive in windows. After beating my head into the wall - finally found that problem was because user had PIN log on. Once we logged on with full password, issue was gone. That's a Microsoft issue - not NAS. Great product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing little NAS system for my personal needs
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little NAS system for my personal needs. My girlfriend and I can both backup our computers over our home network and we can access our files remotely if needed. Super easy to set up also. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: iHeli

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Mac OS, period
customer_reviews.text: This drive will not mount where you expect it (should be /Volumes ends up somewhere else very obscure). Called support, they said it can be changed. Also, is completely incompatible with rsync. For a backup storage server, this is a very bad decision. When mounted, it unmounts spontaneously at random times and you won't be able to reconnect the drive unless you go in their custom utility. Useless for anyone managing a network.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up - Very Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was delivered today and it was exactly what I expected. No issues at all accessing from Windows 10 as I have read here. Mapping a network drive to it was easy using the Windows interface. No special drivers needed. The set up was simple. From the time the unit was delivered to the time I started copying data do it was about 40 minutes. Excellent web based user interface, It is very quiet - virtually silent. This is a software-based RAID but I knew that from reading the reviews. Time will tell of course on how the unit hold up but this is perfect for my needs.
